task.title: Configure the Origin
task.shortdesc: The origin represents the source data for the pipeline. When you configure the origin, you define how to connect to the data, and the type of data you're using.

context.p: In this case, use the Directory origin to process static file data.

step.cmd: In the Stage list, click the Directory origin. After the origin appears in the canvas, select the origin.
step.info: The Properties panel displays the configuration options for the selected stage. Or, if you click an unused section of the pipeline, it displays pipeline properties.

step.cmd: In the Properties panel, click the Files tab and configure the following properties - use defaults for all other properties:

row.entry: Enter the local directory where you saved the source file.
Since the file is the only file in the directory, you can use the asterisk wild card (*) or some version of that, like: *.csv.

step.cmd: For delimited data, additional properties are available, so click the Delimited tab.
The sample data includes a header row, so set the Header Line property to With Header Line.

taskbody.result:
This is how the stage and pipeline should look at this point:
Notice, the error icon on the Directory stage. If you hover over the icon or click the Issues icon, you see from the error message that it's just because you haven't connected it to anything yet. All in good time.
